thread.title: Snacking healthy in Central Florida's theme parks
thread.title_full: Snacking healthy in Central Florida's theme parks

author: Sandy Csizmar
title: Snacking healthy in Central Florida's theme parks
text:
Snacking healthy in Central Florida's theme parks Legoland Florida Legoland Florida 
At the Legoland Hotel, Bricks Restaurant and Skyline Lounge has fresh fruit and fruit and yogurt parfaits available for snacking. 
At the Legoland Hotel, Bricks Restaurant and Skyline Lounge has fresh fruit and fruit and yogurt parfaits available for snacking. (Legoland Florida) What are your favorite healthy snacks at Disney, Universal and other Central Florida attractions? 
Snacking right isn't an easy feat when you're in a theme park. Temptation is everywhere. 
We asked local theme parks -- Walt Disney World, Universal Orlando, SeaWorld Orlando and Legoland Florida -- for guidance on some of their healthier snacking options. Nutritional information generally wasn't available, but the parks supplied us with varying ideas to enjoy the fun without the extra fat calories, and we did additional research ourselves. Caption Disney theme parks Sandy Csizmar / Orlando Sentinel 
Fresh fruits and vegetables -- whole and cut up -- are available around all the Disney theme parks. Pictured is the Harambe Fruit Market at Disney's Animal Kingdom, which has one of the best selections we saw in any park. Anaheim Produce at Disney's Hollywood Studios also has an excellent selection. 
Fresh fruits and vegetables -- whole and cut up -- are available around all the Disney theme parks. Pictured is the Harambe Fruit Market at Disney's Animal Kingdom, which has one of the best selections we saw in any park. Anaheim Produce at Disney's Hollywood Studios also has an excellent selection. (Sandy Csizmar / Orlando Sentinel) Caption Disney theme parks Sandy Csizmar / Orlando Sentinel 
Many other options were available beyond what's on the menu pictured at Harambe Fruit Market in Disney's Animal Kingdom. We suggest sticking to the left side of the menu. 
Many other options were available beyond what's on the menu pictured at Harambe Fruit Market in Disney's Animal Kingdom. We suggest sticking to the left side of the menu. (Sandy Csizmar / Orlando Sentinel) See more galleries 
Click through our gallery of healthy snacking options to learn more -- be sure to click "Show Caption" for details. Come back often, as this project is ongoing. 
Are you a theme park regular with a favorite healthy snack option? We'd like to hear from you. Visit our Facebook post , tweet to us @OSentinelBiz or send an email and we'll include your suggestions in the gallery. 
Some items, like pretzels and popcorn, are hard to judge without the guidance of per serving fat grams and calorie counts. Other treats are prepackaged and have nutritional information listed on the packaging. When all else fails, fresh fruit is available in all the parks.
